title: Optical Chiral Microrobot for Out-of-plane Drilling Motion
authors:
Alaa M. Ali, Edison Gerena, Julio Andr\'es Iglesias Mart\'inez, Gwenn
  Ulliac, Brahim Lemkalli, Abdenbi Mohand-Ousaid, Sinan Haliyo, Aude Bolopion,
  Muamer Kadic
abstract:
Optical Microrobots (Optobots) have demonstrated a keen interest in various
fields including microfluidics, microrobotics, and medicine. Conversely,
optomechanics serves as a crucial domain for theoretical exploration into
concepts such as chirality, duality, and parity concerning optical forces. In
this paper, we elucidate a method to amalgamate chirality through broken axial
parity into optobots, thereby augmenting their versatility. Specifically, we
illustrate how this integration allows for out-of-plane rotation which helps in
their utilization as optical drills under unidirectional excitation achieved
through repetitive stimulation of three focal regions: two traps and one chiral
rotational site. We fabricate the microrobots employing two-photon lithography,
and note a highly satisfactory correspondence between finite element
calculations and experimental observations.
